meanings.definition: A comic actor in opera or theater.
meanings.sent1: The buffo made everyone laugh with his silly antics on stage.
meanings.sent2: The audience enjoyed the performance of the buffo in the opera.
meanings.sent3: The buffo's exaggerated expressions brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: His comedic timing was so impeccable, he truly embodied the essence of a buffo.
meanings.sent5: The buffo's presence on stage was like a burst of joy in a dull world.

meanings.definition: A style of comic opera originating in Italy.
meanings.sent1: The buffo opera was filled with humorous dialogues and lively music.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed watching the traditional buffo performances at the Italian opera house.
meanings.sent3: The buffo opera had the audience chuckling throughout the entire show.
meanings.sent4: The essence of the buffo style added a touch of whimsy to the opera performance.
meanings.sent5: The colorful costumes and playful melodies made the buffo opera a delight to watch.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at making jokes or being funny.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the office buffo for his ability to lighten the mood with his jokes.
meanings.sent2: The buffo at the party had everyone in stitches with his witty remarks.
meanings.sent3: Being the buffo of the group, she always had a clever quip ready.
meanings.sent4: His humor was so infectious, he naturally became the buffo of the class.
meanings.sent5: In every gathering, he effortlessly assumed the role of the buffo, spreading laughter all around.
